titles.title: Marriage IRA Fairness Act of 2001
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate the marriage penalty with regard to income limits for the IRA deduction for active participants in pension plans.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 4/26/2001--Introduced. Marriage IRA Fairness Act of 2001 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to make the applicable joint filer dollar amount limitation, with respect to the IRA deduction for active participants in certain pension plans, twice the amount available to other filers (other than married filing separately).
